result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry Allan Stein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pay all supervision fees.
03-21-2016 Judge Dennis R. Cimpl signs order that the defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No alcohol or controlled substances.

- Cooperate with agent.
- Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended.
- Follow all rules of extended supervision.

- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Letter to defendant.
Letter from defendant requesting sentence credit.

The docket sheet and Judgment of Conviction states that the defendant is not eligible for The Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program when in fact the Court stated the defendant is eligible for both these programs.  Also, the Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence has an incorrect case number - 15CF1471.  The correct case number belonging to this defendant is 15CF1816.

Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in Judgment of Conviction signed and filed.
records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: The docket sheet and Judgment of Conviction states that the defendant is not eligible for The Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program when in fact the Court stated the defendant is eligible for both these programs.  Also, the Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence has an incorrect case number - 15CF1471.  The correct case number belonging to this defendant is 15CF1816.

Defendant Terry Allan Stein in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Terry Allan Stein in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.  Court further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of  1 1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 1/2 YEARS, with credit for 138 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Defendant to pay a fine in the amount of $600.00 PLUS Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant to pay the outstanding balance with WCS, to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain full-time employment  
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Defendant's driving privileges revoked for 2 years
-Ignition interlock for a period of 2 years; defendant to pay applicable fees 

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. 

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Terry Allan Stein in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Terry Allan Stein in custody.  Ronald Dague for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  ALSO SCRAM.
  No driving without a valid license.
